law.text: The cabinet shall make investigations, collect and compile statistics and report on the conditions of industries, labor and unemployment, and upon all matters relating to employer-employee relations and working conditions. Complete permanent records shall be made of all investigations, showing date of examination, condition in which the establishment was found, and changes ordered.
law.history: Amended 2010 Ky. Acts ch. 24, sec. 1706, effective July 15, 2010. -- Recodified 1942 Ky. Acts ch. 208, sec. 1, effective October 1, 1942, from Ky. Stat. secs. 33a-7, 1599c-9.
